reference.text: reading desks A47B19/00; book rests A47B23/00

note.note-paragraph: The words "filing appliance" in this subclass mean holders for collections of papers, sheets, cards, or units thereof, each paper, sheet, card, or unit being individually insertable and extractable. These words may thus include a calendar, an instruction manual, or a letter file
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Sheets temporarily attached together without perforating

title-part.text: on two bars relatively movable longitudinally
pivotable about an axis or axes parallel to binding edges
in two sections engaging each other when closed
wherein one section is in the form of fixed rods
and locked when so engaged, e.g. snap-action
having a set of rods within a set of tubes for a substantial distance when closed
the nesting portions of the rods and tubes being straight
with the rods locking in the tubes
combined or formed with other articles, e.g. punches, stands

and are pivotable relative to the bottom of their containers
Connections between the cards and their containers
